rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment describes notification of changes factually without high-potency language.
The segment describes future actions and outcomes.
The segment does not contain a question.
The segment reports supermarkets will put up signs and eggs will go back to free-range, which is factual/informational, not explicit calming.
The segment states supermarkets 'will put up signs' and 'eggs will go back to being free-range', which are not bare negations.
Reports actions taken: 'supermarkets will put up signs notifying customers of the change'.
